item.title: How are blogs built
item.author: Author
item.description: How are most of the websites/blogs built? Really? Typically, there are two layers of website building: Pull content from local file system (md files) or third party CMS Render the website The first layer - Content pulling Conventional blog engines hosted on GitHub (Hexo, Hugo, Jekyll) host their “content” in files stored and managed by Git. Gatsby and Gridsome, besides supporting file-based content sourcing, also have plugins that enables them to pull “content” from a third-party CMS, whether it’s a self-hosted WordPress or Ghost, or a standalone cloud-based solution like Strapi, DatoCMS, or Contentful.
